examples: We'll meet by the pier at sundown.

entries.meaning: (countable) A hat with a wide brim to shade the eyes from sunlight.

verbs.description: sundown (third-person singular simple present sundowns, present participle sundowning, simple past and past participle sundowned)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) to experience an episode or an onset of some detrimental mental condition like agitation, anxiety, hallucination or dementia, daily at nightfall.
examples: "She also “sundowned”, and someone had to keep an eye on her 24-7."
